head.title: Welcome to the DocBook Open Repository

row.entry: For a wide range of up-to-date information about DocBook, see the DocBook Wiki. The pages at this site contain specific information about the DocBook Open Repository project at SourceForge.

section.title: About the DocBook Open Repository Project
section.para: The DocBook Open Repository project supports the open source development of a variety of DocBook resources. In particular, it is the official repository for the DocBook XSL and DSSSL stylesheets. It also the home for a number of other document types, schemas, and stylesheets that are derived from or otherwise related to DocBook.
It is important to note that OASIS remains the official home of the DocBook DTD.

section.title: About DocBook
section.para: DocBook is a document type definition (DTD) in SGML and XML. It is particularly well suited to books and papers about computer hardware and software (though it is by no means limited to these applications).
DocBook is an OASIS Standard. It is a work product of the DocBook Technical Committee. OASIS is the official governing body for all matters related to the DocBook DTD.

DocBook enables you to author and store document content in a presentation-neutral form that captures the logical structure of the content. Using free tools along with the DocBook XSL and DSSSL Stylesheets, you can transform, format, and publish your content as HTML pages and PDF files, and in many other formats.
The official documentation for DocBook is DocBook: The Definitive Guide, published by O'Reilly & Associates, Inc. This documentation is also available online.

The DocBook Wiki provides a comprehensive variety of up-to-date details about DocBook, including user-contributed information and links, in a format that you can edit and add to. You should take a minute to read the rules before making any changes.
